bug.author: ydcjeff
bug.summary: AttributeError: partially initialized module 'wandb' has no attribute 'Api' (most likely due to a circular import)
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.9.4 Python version: 3.8 Operating System: Ubuntu
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
wandb has no attribute Api when trying to run on my laptop and github actions. Error message on local (macOS 10.15.6): AttributeError: module 'wandb' has no attribute 'Api' Error message on github actions: AttributeError: partially initialized module 'wandb' has no attribute 'Api' (most likely due to a circular import) <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://docs.wandb.com/library/api/examples#export-metrics-from-all-runs-in-a-project-to-a-csv-file>Same code from the docs</denchmark-link> , modified to my needs import os import datetime import pandas import wandb import json
os.environ['WANDB_API_KEY'] = '*******************************'
api = wandb.Api()
projects = api.projects() project_list = [p.name for p in projects] entity = [p.entity for p in projects]
summary_list = [] config_list = [] name_list = []
for i, p in enumerate(project_list): for run in api.runs(f'{entity[i]}/{p}'): # run.summary are the output key/values like accuracy. # We call ._json_dict to omit large files summary_list.append(run.summary._json_dict)
# run.config is the input metrics. # We remove special values that start with _. config = {k: v for k, v in run.config.items() if not k.startswith('_')} config_list.append(config)
# run.name is the name of the run. name_list.append(run.name)
summary_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(summary_list) config_df = pd.DataFrame.from_records(config_list) name_df = pd.DataFrame({'name': name_list}) df = pd.concat([name_df, config_df, summary_df], axis=1) d = dict(df.loc[df['epoch_train_loss'].idxmin()])
with open(f'{p}.json', 'w') as f: json.dump(d, f) Error trace from github actions ‚¨áÔ∏è <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32727188/89392129-1f7de300-d72f-11ea-8c9c-d18808ad406a.png></denchmark-link>

Thank you for reporting! Looking into this.

hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ydcjeff>@ydcjeff</denchmark-link> can you please rename the file from wandb.py to something else, and make sure there is no file named wandb.py in the directory, and try running the code again?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tyomhak>@tyomhak</denchmark-link> It's working Really sorry for the inconvenience
